title: System Engineer - Control Systems, Communications and Instrumentation
body:
Requisition ID: 225360

PENDING NOTICE TO PROCEED


Project Overview:
Rio Tinto is investigating in the development of the lithium-borosilicate deposit of a unique mineral jadarite found near the town of Loznica in Serbia (the Jadar Project). The Jadar project comprises an underground mine, a mineral processing plant, product load out facilities, a waste management system and associated infrastructure. Bechtel has been selected as the project management contractor and we are building a team that will work on the project delivery and the completion of the prefeasibility study.


Job Overview:
The System Engineer (SE) - Control Systems, Communications and Instrumentation will overview the design of the Process Control System (PCS), instrumentation and communications for the mine, process plant and infrastructure areas. In addition, the SE is responsible for management of the Main Automation Contractor (MAC) package, the management of associated procurement packages and provide technical oversight for other design contractors and construction contracts. The SE will report day to day to the Project Engineering Manager and functionally to the M&M Chief Electrical Engineer.


Summary:
Coordinates the design of the PCS, Safety Instrumented Systems (SIS) and communication systems for the mine, process plant and infrastructure during the PFS, FS, FEED and Detailed Design phases of the project.

Coordinates the selection of the most appropriate Process Control Philosophy (PCP), PCS architecture, design criteria, and specifications during an Early Tenderer Involvement (ETI) process.

Coordinates the selection of the most appropriate instrumentation technologies and standardization across the project.

Liaises with the Client with regards to technology selection, operation readiness, engineering governance, functional safety and cyber security requirements.

Liaises with discipline engineering to ensure that design, procurement and contract related items are carried out in accordance with the project execution plan.

Liaises with the Project Controls, Procurement, Contracts, Construction and Start-up functions to ensure engineering is executed in support of Project Delivery.

Coordinates all technical aspects of the MAC package and associated discipline procurement packages and design contracts.

Monitors schedule and cost performance of applicable design contractors.

Drives process innovation associated with the PCS, Communications and Instrumentation.

Planning and coordinating of the applicable risk assessments, HAZOPs, CHAZOPs, HSECiD, HSECiC, constructability reviews and process safety studies for the applicable facilities and systems.

Identify and manage technical risks using appropriate risk management processes and tools.

Identify, challenge and trend any changes that deviate from the project scope baseline and the facility scope documentation before proceeding with implementing the change.

Carries out technical review of discipline engineering documentation as required


JOB DIMENSIONS:


A Supervision Received

  • Receives technical and administrative supervision from the Project Engineering Manager.

B. Supervision Exercised

  • Manages the MAC contractor and provides supervision over discipline engineers and designers


C. Contacts

  • Liaises with the Client with regards to technology transfer, operation readiness and engineering governance requirements.
  • Liaises with the Project Controls, Procurement, Contracts, Construction and Start-up functions to ensure engineering is executed in support of Project Delivery.
  • Liaises with discipline engineering to ensure that procurement and contract related items are carried out in accordance with the project execution plan.
  • Liaises with the permitting team, permitting consultants and technical control contractors to ensure that design is carried out in accordance with Serbian laws
  • Coordinates all technical correspondence related to the MAC package.
  • Bechtel-Client contact on engineering aspects of assigned project, maintains regular client contact for progress of work, exchange of information, advice, operational readiness etc.


ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES:

  • Coordinates all technical correspondence related to the PCS, communications infrastructure and instrumentation.
  • Monitors schedule and cost performance of designers.
  • Assists contracts with the administration of external engineering companies.
  • Responsible for the following for the applicable facilities:
    • Production of agreed facility scope documentation in accordance with the project schedule.
    • Planning and coordinating hazard studies and design reviews (feasibility, 30%, 60% & 90% model and constructability reviews) for their nominated facilities and closing out actions in a timely fashion.
    • Identify and manage system performance risks using appropriate risk management processes and tools.
    • Identify, challenge and trend any changes that deviate from the project scope baseline and the facility scope documentation before proceeding with implementing the change.
    • Review of discipline engineering documentation as required
    • Validation of licensed engineers and maintenance of tracking register.
    • Liaison with permit team and technical control contractor.
    • Liasing with operational readiness team.
    • Coordinates material requisitions and works contracts with discipline engineers and contracts

JOB KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS:

  • Technical knowledge of related engineering systems, engineering calculations, applications of engineering and construction methods and materials, and engineering application of computers.
  • Knowledge of engineering technology and design methods.
  • Knowledge of related construction practices and the economics involved and current knowledge of new methods of design and construction.
  • Knowledge of industry/regulatory codes and standards and design criteria pertinent to the particular discipline.
  • Office automation skills, primarily word processing and spreadsheet tools.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Self-motivated individual with outstanding leadership skills and the ability to influence without authority.
  • Ability to manage priorities and take on additional evolving responsibilities with demonstrated experience providing direction/supervising a team and / or contractor.

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Recognized degree in electrical, automation or ICE Engineering
  • 10+ years’ experience in the engineering and construction industry and
  • Prior extensive work experience in mineral processing facilities leading to a thorough understanding of the role requirements as listed.

Salary will be based on current market rates and the posted grade will not be adjusted to suit the successful candidate.
